result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Naima E, Aomar E, or Fatima E. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Adam Ouahidy in court.  Attorney Dominic Richards in court for Adam Ouahidy.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. All other conditions will remain the same.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Adam Ouahidy in court.  Attorney Dominic Richards in court for Adam Ouahidy.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 2. Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam Ouahidy in court via Zoom from St Marys hospital.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Adam Ouahidy. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Brief adjournment. 1:57 PM Case re-called. Further arguments.
